# prep library
library(shiny)
library(tidyverse)
library(ggpubr)
library(scales)
library(glue)
library(plotly)
library(shinydashboard)
library(DT)

# read data
workers <- read.csv("data_input/jobs_gender.csv")

# read theme

theme_algoritma <- readRDS("theme_algoritma.rds")

# cleaning data
workers_clean <- workers %>% 
    drop_na(total_earnings_male, total_earnings_female) %>% 
    select(-wage_percent_of_male)


# header ------------------------------------------------------------------

    
header <-  dashboardHeader(title = "Gender Gap Analysis")

# sidebar -----------------------------------------------------------------

    
sidebar <- dashboardSidebar(
        sidebarMenu(
            menuItem("Overview", 
                     tabName = "overview", 
                     icon = icon("dashboard")),
            menuItem("Source Data", 
                     icon = icon("table"),
                     tabName = "table"
                    )
        )
    )

# body --------------------------------------------------------------------


body <- dashboardBody(
        tabItems(
            tabItem(tabName = "overview",
                    h2("US Labor Force Participation Data"),
                    fluidRow(
                        valueBox(value = mean(workers_clean$total_earnings),
                                 subtitle = "Mean Earnings",
                                 icon = icon("address-card"),
                                 color = "red"),
                        valueBox(value = sum(workers_clean$workers_male),
                                 subtitle = "Total Workers Male",
                                 icon = icon("male"),
                                 color = "red"),
                        valueBox(value = sum(workers_clean$workers_female),
                                 subtitle = "Total Workers Female",
                                 icon = icon("female"),
                                 color= "red")
                    ),
                    fluidRow(
                        column( width = 3,
                            selectInput(
                            inputId = "select_year",
                            label = "Select Year",
                            choices = unique(workers_clean$year)
                    ))
                    
                    ),
                    fluidRow(
                        column(width = 7,
                               plotlyOutput(outputId = "gender_plot")),
                        column(width = 5,
                               plotlyOutput(outputId = "scatter_plot"))
                    )
                    
                    
                    ),
            tabItem(tabName = "table")
        )
    )


ui <- dashboardPage( title = "My Dashboard",
               skin = "red",
               header = header,
               sidebar = sidebar,
               body = body
)


server <- function(input, output) {

# output gender plot ------------------------------------------------------


    output$gender_plot <- renderPlotly({
        
        #data aggregasi
        
        workers_gap <- workers_clean %>% 
            filter( year == 2016) %>% 
            mutate( percent_male = 100 - percent_female) %>% 
            group_by(major_category) %>% 
            summarise( Male = mean(percent_male),
                       Female = mean(percent_female)) %>% 
            ungroup() %>% 
            mutate(major_category = reorder(major_category, Male-Female)) %>% 
            pivot_longer(cols = -major_category) %>% 
            mutate(text = glue('{name}: {round(value,2)} %'))
        
        #visualisasi data
        
        plot3 <- ggplot(data = workers_gap,mapping = aes(x = value,y = major_category, text = text))+
            geom_col(aes(fill = name))+
            geom_vline(xintercept = 50, linetype = "dotted")+
            labs(x = NULL,
                 y = NULL,
                 title = "US Labor Force Participation in 2016")+
            theme(legend.position = "none")+
            scale_x_continuous(labels = unit_format(unit = "%"))+
            theme_algoritma
        
        #interaktif plot
        ggplotly(plot3, tooltip = "text")
        
    })

# output scatter plot -----------------------------------------------------

    
    output$scatter_plot <- renderPlotly({
        
        
    }) 
    
}

# Run the application 
shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server)
